meanings.definition: A person who throws something with great force.
meanings.sent1: The baseball pitcher was known as one of the strongest hurlers in the league.
meanings.sent2: The hurlers at the track and field competition amazed the crowd with their strength.
meanings.sent3: The hurlers at the carnival game tried to knock down the stacked cans with their throws.
meanings.sent4: She was a hurler of insults, aiming her words with precision and force.
meanings.sent5: The hurlers in the ancient war paintings looked fierce and determined.

meanings.definition: A group of players in the sport of hurling.
meanings.sent1: The local hurlers practiced on the field every evening to improve their skills.
meanings.sent2: The hurlers from different counties competed in the championship match.
meanings.sent3: The hurlers celebrated their victory with a team dinner at the local restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The hurlers moved swiftly across the field, passing the ball with precision.
meanings.sent5: The hurlers wore their team colors proudly during the tournament.

meanings.definition: A device used for throwing or launching something.
meanings.sent1: The trebuchet was a powerful hurler of stones during medieval battles.
meanings.sent2: The toy hurler launched small foam balls across the room.
meanings.sent3: The automatic hurler in the factory helped speed up the production process.
meanings.sent4: The water balloon hurler was a hit at the summer party, drenching everyone in sight.
meanings.sent5: The potato hurler at the fair could launch spuds over great distances.
